title: 108_s1582
content: The Act titled "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 is amended to allow the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests with available funds, and if negotiations fail, the Secretary can acquire the interests through a declaration of taking. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow the Secretary to pay any difference in compensation from a permanent judgment appropriation. The Trust is given authority to determine obligations and expenditures, and the solicitation of donations is restricted to specific members. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows the Trust to solicit donations from specific members and use proceeds from activities on the Baca Ranch or Preserve after October 27, 1999. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows the Trust to solicit donations and use proceeds from activities on the Baca Ranch or Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act (U.S.C. 698v-5(e)) is amended to specify the selection and compensation of the chair of the Board of Trustees, with a maximum rate of pay not to exceed 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The maximum rate of pay for the chair of the Board of Trustees shall not exceed 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. (a) Property Disposal Limitations amended to include exclusions for forage, forest products, and renewable resources. (b) Law Enforcement and Fire Management section amended for better clarity. The Law Enforcement and Fire Management section of the Trust is amended to include provisions for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve. The Secretary shall develop a plan in consultation with the Trust, consistent with the management program. The Secretary will provide services through a cooperative agreement with the Trust for fire preparedness, suppression, and rehabilitation on the Preserve. Reimbursable services may also be provided for presuppression and nonemergency restoration. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
